title: Nobel Institute says Peace Prize cannot be transferred after Machado suggestion
byline: The Norwegian Nobel Institute said the Nobel Peace Prize cannot be transferred, shared, or revoked, following remarks by Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado suggesting she might give her 2025 award to U.S. President Donald Trump.

title: Minister instructs restoration of damaged elephant fences within a week
byline: A progress review meeting on the restoration of elephant fences damaged by the Cyclone Ditwah has been held yesterday (10) under the patronage of Minister of Environment Dr. Dammika Patabendi.

title: Bob Weir, Grateful Dead co-founder and rhythm guitarist, dead at 78
byline: Veteran rock musician Bob Weir, the Grateful Dead’s rhythm guitarist who helped guide the legendary jam band through decades of change and success, has died at age 78, according to a statement posted to his verified Instagram account on Saturday.

title: Civil Aviation Authority to introduce proper regulatory framework for drones
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) says that a proper regulatory framework will be introduced to regulate the use of drones.

title: Low pressure area over Gulf of Mannar weakens further
byline: The low pressure area over the Gulf of Mannar in Sri Lanka is weakening further. Therefore, the influence of this system on the island’s weather is further gradually reducing, the Department of Meteorology announced.

title: US military strikes Islamic State group targets in Syria, officials say
byline: The US and its partner forces have carried out large-scale strikes against Islamic State (IS) group targets in Syria, the US Central Command (Centcom) has announced.

title: Two including 16-year old electrocuted to death in separate incidents
byline: Two individuals, including a 16-year-old boy, have reportedly died after being electrocuted in separate incidents reported from the Kuchchaveli and Rasnayakapura Police areas.

title: Over 1500 awareness programs conducted by CAA in 2025
byline: The Consumer Affairs Authority (CAA) says it has conducted a total of 1,540 consumer awareness programs during the year 2025.

title: Trump says US will do something on Greenland ‘whether they like it or not’
byline: US President Donald Trump on Friday continued to press for U.S. control of Greenland, telling reporters: “We are going to do something on Greenland whether they like it or not.”

title: Bus fares via bank cards now available in Uva Province
byline: Under the government’s national digitalization initiative, a system enabling bus fare payments via bank cards has now been introduced in the Uva Province as well.

title: Steps being taken to systematically conduct preschool teacher training and ensure quality standards - PM
byline: Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated that the Government has commenced necessary measures to maintain preschool education under a framework, align preschool education with a unified curriculum, conduct teacher training in a systematic manner, and ensure quality standards.

title: US seizes fifth oil tanker linked to Venezuela, officials say
byline: US forces have seized another tanker in the Caribbean Sea, officials say, as the Trump administration continues its efforts to control exports of Venezuelan oil.

title: Sajith, Dilith lead opposition protest to ‘protect free education’
byline: Several opposition political parties staged a protest this evening (10) under the theme “Let’s Protect Free Education”, against the proposed education reforms and the Minister of Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: Five arrested in foreign employment scam involving forged documents
byline: The Special Investigation Unit of the Sri Lanka Bureau of Foreign Employment (SLBFE) has arrested five suspects in connection with foreign employment scams involving the preparation of forged documents.

title: Opposition to begin public signature drive for no-confidence motion against Education Minister
byline: The General Secretary of the Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB), Ranjith Madduma Bandara, has announced that the collection of public signatures in support of the no-confidence motion against Minister of Education, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, will commence today (10 January).

title: Rare copy of the comic book that introduced the world to Superman sells for $15 million
byline: A rare copy of the comic book that introduced the world to Superman and also was once stolen from the home of actor Nicolas Cage has been sold for a record $15 million.

title: Five injured in van accident after attending cricket match in Dambulla
byline: Five individuals were injured in a road accident that occurred in the Mihintale area along the A9 Main Road in the early hours of this morning (10).

title: Police foil attempt to kill businessman in Mattakkuliya; 4 arrested with firearm
byline: Police have arrested four suspects along with a firearm and ammunition in connection with an alleged attempt to shoot and kill a businessman in Mattakkuliya, Colombo.

title: After 25 years of talks, EU & Mercosur agree to the highly contested free trade agreement
byline: The European Union on Friday reached a free trade agreement with South American countries, 25 years after talks began, despite opposition from farmers in several European countries.

title: Negombo pharmacy owner arrested for possession of various narcotics
byline: A 32-year-old resident of Negombo was apprehended with a range of narcotics during a search of a suspicious vehicle near the Periyamulla–Eththukala railway crossing.

title: CEB employees who applied for voluntary retirement write to Energy Minister over delays
byline: Employees of the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB), who applied for the Voluntary Retirement Scheme (VRS), have written to Minister of Energy, Engineer Kumara Jayakody, highlighting several issues they are facing, including the delay in gazetting the ‘Appointed Date’ for CEB Restructuring.

title: Muslim public servants to be granted flexible work schedules during Ramadan
byline: The Ministry of Public Administration, Home Affairs, Provincial Councils, and Local Government has instructed state institutions to arrange work shifts for Muslim public servants to enable them to observe religious practices during the holy month of Ramadan.

title: Death toll climbs after trash site collapse buries dozens in Philippines
byline: Hard hat-wearing rescue workers and backhoes dug through rubble in search of survivors on Saturday (Jan 10) in the shadow of a mountain of garbage that buried dozens of landfill employees in the central Philippines, killing at least four.

title: Depression over Bay of Bengal likely to cross Mullaitivu Coast; heavy rain and winds expected
byline: The Department of Meteorology reports that the depression over the southwest Bay of Bengal was located about 20 km east of Mullaitivu at 11:30 a.m. today (10).

title: Official website of Ministry of Public Security temporarily unavailable
byline: The official website of the Ministry of Public Security and Parliamentary Affairs is currently inaccessible.

title: ‘High School Musical 3’ actor Matt Prokop arrested on alleged child pornography charges
byline: Former teen actor Matt Prokop has been arrested in Texas and is currently being held without bail following multiple charges, including alleged possession of child pornography.

title: Magnitude 6.8 earthquake strikes off Indonesia’s Talaud Islands
byline: An earthquake of magnitude 6.8 struck off the coast of Indonesia’s Talaud Islands on Saturday (Jan 10), the German Research Center for Geosciences (GFZ) said.

title: Galenbindunuwewa house fire claims fourth victim as 15-year-old girl succumbs
byline: A 15-year-old girl who sustained critical injuries in a recent house fire in the Galenbindunuwewa area of Anuradhapura has succumbed to her injuries, bringing the death toll from the incident to four, police confirmed.

title: Traffic restrictions on Colombo-Kandy road in Kadawatha due to construction
byline: The Police have announced that traffic on the Colombo-Kandy Road will be restricted in the Kadawatha area due to ongoing construction activities.

title: Gang rivalry suspected in restaurant owner’s murder on Marine Drive
byline: Preliminary investigations have revealed that the murder of a restaurant owner on Marine Drive in Dehiwala, was the result of a dispute between members of rival criminal gangs, police said.

title: TIN mandatory for vehicle registration and ownership transfer from January 5
byline: The Department of Motor Traffic has made it mandatory to enter the Taxpayer Identification Number (TIN) in new vehicle registration and ownership transfer data systems of the Department of Motor Traffic during vehicle registration and transfer of ownership.

title: US ‘Doomsday Plane’ makes rare appearance in 51 years amid global tensions
byline: The US military’s highly classified “Doomsday Plane” – a Cold War–era airborne command centre built to withstand nuclear war – made an unusually public appearance this week, sparking widespread speculation at a time of escalating geopolitical strain.

title: Musk’s X to open source new algorithm in seven days
byline: Elon Musk said on Saturday that social media platform X will open to the public its new algorithm, including all code for organic and advertising post recommendations, in seven days.

title: Minister announces plans to strengthen domestic aviation to boost tourism
byline: Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation Anura Karunathilake says a programme will be implemented to strengthen Sri Lanka’s domestic aviation sector in order to support the development of the tourism industry.

title: Insurance scheme launched for seed paddy production farms
byline: The Agricultural and Agrarian Insurance Board says the project to provide coverage for paddy cultivation in seed paddy production farms, has been launched enabling farmers to successfully manage their farms amid prevailing risk conditions.

title: NBRO extends landslide warnings despite slight reduction in rainfall
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has decided to further extend landslide warnings despite a slight reduction in rainfall, according to Dr. Wasantha Senadheera, Senior Geologist at the NBRO.

title: CID launches probe into Public Security Ministry website breach
byline: The Criminal Investigation Department (CID) has launched an inquiry following reports that the official website of the Ministry of Public Security was targeted by external parties.

title: Death toll from Iran protest violence ‘reaches 116’
byline: The death toll from violence surrounding nationwide protests challenging Iran’s leadership has reached at least 116 people, activists say.

title: Postal Department records Rs. 13,100 million in revenue in 2025
byline: The Sri Lanka Postal Department has exceeded the revenue target set by the Treasury for last year, the department noted.

title: Education reforms necessary but reconsider the process: Maha Sangha
byline: Although there is a need for educational reforms in schools, the process in which the present administration is carrying them out is not acceptable, Senior Professor Venerable Pathegama Gnanissara Thero noted.

title: Train operations to Kandy within one year - Dy Minister of Transport
byline: All efforts are being taken to resume train operations to Kandy within one year, according to Deputy Minister of Transport and Highways Prasanna Gunasena.

title: Man dies in road accident in Melsiripura
byline: An individual has died following a road accident that occurred in Nabeta, Melsiripura.

title: US warns Americans to leave Venezuela immediately as armed militias set up roadblocks
byline: The U.S. government issued a new security alert Saturday urging Americans in Venezuela to leave the country immediately, citing security concerns and the U.S. government’s inability to provide emergency assistance, according to the U.S. Embassy Caracas.

title: Israel on high alert for possibility of US intervention in Iran, sources say
byline: Israel is on high alert for the possibility of any United States intervention in Iran as authorities there confront the biggest anti-government protests in years, according to three Israeli sources with knowledge of the matter.

title: National Visual Record Exhibition on the impact of Cyclone Ditwah in February
byline: The government is preparing to publish a National Visual Record on the impact of Cyclone Ditwah on Sri Lanka and the subsequent recovery and reconstruction process with the President’s Media Division taking the lead role in collaboration with the Clean Sri Lanka Secretariat.

title: Showers above 50 mm expected in Eastern, Uva and Sabaragamuwa provinces
byline: Showers have been predicted in the Northern, North-central, Uva, Eastern and Central provinces and the Hambantota district tomorrow (12).

title: China’s Foreign Minister to arrive in Sri Lanka
byline: The Foreign Minister of China, Wang Yi is scheduled to arrive in the country tonight (11).

title: Iran vows to strike back if US attacks as regime change protests continue
byline: Iran’s President Masoud Pezeshkian said that the United States and Israel want to create chaos and disorder in Iran by ordering riots, urging Iranians to distance themselves from “rioters and terrorists.”

title: Tamil Nadu CM writes to Indian PM Modi over Sri Lanka’s proposed constitutional reforms
byline: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has written to Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, urging the central government to take proactive and high-level diplomatic steps to protect the welfare, political rights, and constitutional aspirations of Sri Lankan Tamils amid proposed constitutional reforms in Sri Lanka.

title: Train operations s between Maho and Anuradhapura suspended from Jan. 19
byline: Train operations between the Maho Junction and Anuradhapura railway stations will be suspended for renovation activities, Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake.

title: Australia bushfires to burn out of control for weeks, authorities say
byline: Australian authorities said on Sunday (Jan 11) it would take firefighters weeks to get on top of bushfires in the country’s southeast that have razed homes, cut power to thousands of homes and burned swathes of bushland.

title: ISRO spy satellite launch tomorrow to boost India’s private space ecosystem
byline: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) will launch its 64th Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle (PSLV) mission tomorrow, marking a critical moment for India’s space program and signalling the rise of the country’s private space ecosystem.

title: Postponed 2025 A/L exams to resume tomorrow
byline: The remaining subjects of the 2025 GCE Advanced Level (A/L) examination, which were postponed due to the disaster situation in the country, are scheduled to be held from tomorrow (12).

title: Restoration work of Northern and Talaimannar railway lines commences
byline: Restoration work of the Northern and Talaimannar railway lines was launched today (11).

title: Ratnapura registers highest temperate while Nuwara Eliya remains below 20 °C
byline: Ratnapura recorded the highest temperature in the island today with 33.1 °C.

title: Train operations between Maho and Anuradhapura suspended from Jan. 19
byline: Train operations between the Maho Junction and Anuradhapura railway stations will be suspended for renovation activities, Minister of Transport Bimal Rathnayake.

title: Hollywood stars battle for awards at 2026 Golden Globes
byline: Leonardo DiCaprio, Timothée Chalamet and other top names will compete for top honours at the 2026 Golden Globe Awards, a key event in the run-up to the Academy Awards.

title: Donald Trump tells Cuba to ‘make a deal, before it is too late’
byline: US President Donald Trump urged Cuba on Sunday (Jan 11) to “make a deal” or face unspecified consequences, warning that the flow of Venezuelan oil and money to Havana would now stop.

title: Risk of flooding in several areas subsides
byline: The risk of flooding in several parts of the country has now subsided, according to the Department of Irrigation.
